pullRequest.body:
---
Himp can be expressed in terms of sSup. Does this fit into mathlib?

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fa93e2fb85](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20328/commits/fa93e2fb854e206d38b243a98ee0f3072f66f2df)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ compl_eq_sSup_disjoint`
`+ himp_eq_sSup`
`+ hnot_eq_sInf_codisjoint`
`+ isGreatest_compl`
`+ isGreatest_himp`
`+ isLeast_hnot`
`+ isLeast_sdiff`
`+ sdiff_eq_sInf`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

There you go:
```
theorem isGreatest_himp {α} [GeneralizedHeytingAlgebra α] (a b : α) :
    IsGreatest {w | w ⊓ a ≤ b} (a ⇨ b) := by simp [IsGreatest, mem_upperBounds]

theorem isLeast_himp {α} [GeneralizedCoheytingAlgebra α] (a b : α) : IsLeast {w | a ≤ b ⊔ w} (a \ b) := by
  simp [IsLeast, mem_lowerBounds]
```
and yes please add those lemmas as well as their `sSup`/`sInf` corollaries. Thanks!

Thank you for the review!
I added these two in the middle:
```lean
lemma isGreatest_sSup {α} [CompleteSemilatticeSup α] (a : α) (s : Set α) :
  IsGreatest s a → sSup s = a :=
    fun h ↦ IsLUB.sSup_eq (IsGreatest.isLUB h)

lemma isLeast_sInf {α} [CompleteSemilatticeInf α] (a : α) (s : Set α) :
  IsLeast s a → sInf s = a :=
    fun h ↦ IsGLB.sInf_eq (IsLeast.isGLB h)  
``` 

Are they to trivial or should I do a seperate PR with these two (probably in a different file)?
Yeah, that would make a lot of sense

This holds a little more generally as
```lean

theorem isGreatest_hImp {α} [GeneralizedHeytingAlgebra α] (a b : α) : IsGreatest {w | w ⊓ a ≤ b} (a ⇨ b) := by
  constructor
  · simp [mem_upperBounds]
  · intro a ha
    simp_all

theorem isLeast_hImp {α} [GeneralizedCoheytingAlgebra α] (a b : α) : IsLeast {w | a ≤ b ⊔ w} (a \ b) := by)
  constructor
  · simp [mem_lowerBounds]
  · intro a ha
    simp_all
```
where the proofs could possibly be golfed.

Perhaps @YaelDillies has opinions on how many versions of this we actually want.
Please avoid squeezing terminal simps
Ohh, ok, I did not know that...
I doubt we need those lemmas as they are a straightforward combination of two simpler lemmas

```suggestion
  isGreatest_himp.isLUB.sSup_eq
```
... if you make the two arguments to `isGreatest_himp` implicit
Ok, this looks a lot cleaner :smile:
The name of this lemma (and the one below) is flipped with respect to the statement. I think probably the name is good and you should reverse the statement.
Does `#find_,home` suggest any earlier files for this lemma?

It suggests all of these: [Mathlib.Data.Int.LeastGreatest, Mathlib.Order.Bounds.Basic, Mathlib.Order.WellFounded, Mathlib.Data.Matrix.CharP, Mathlib.Order.Bounds.Image, Mathlib.Order.Filter.Defs, Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.Pi]
Maybe Order.Bounds.Basic would be a good place?
Sounds good; please also move the lemma below this one
I'm not really sure where to put these... Should they  go into their own section?
This should be moved to a `Coframe` section of this file.

```suggestion
  (isLeast_sdiff a b).isGLB.sInf_eq.symm
```

I think there is already an ambient variable here?
```suggestion
theorem isGreatest_himp [GeneralizedHeytingAlgebra α] (a b : α) :
    IsGreatest {w | w ⊓ a ≤ b} (a ⇨ b) := by
  simp [IsGreatest, mem_upperBounds]

theorem isLeast_sdiff [GeneralizedCoheytingAlgebra α] (a b : α) :
    IsLeast {w | a ≤ b ⊔ w} (a \ b) := by
  simp [IsLeast, mem_lowerBounds]
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  simp [← Coframe.top_sdiff,sdiff_eq_sInf,codisjoint_iff, sup_comm]
```
Can you add the `isGreatest` spelling of this one too?

I suspect having implicit arguments here will be generally more useful
```suggestion
theorem isGreatest_himp [GeneralizedHeytingAlgebra α] {a b : α} :
```

```suggestion
theorem isGreatest_compl [HeytingAlgebra α] (a : α) :
    IsGreatest {w | Disjoint w a} (aᶜ) := by
  simpa only [← himp_bot, disjoint_iff_inf_le] using isGreatest_himp

theorem isLeast_hnot [CoheytingAlgebra α] (a : α) :
    IsLeast {w | Codisjoint a w} (￢a) := by
  simpa only [← top_sdiff, codisjoint_iff_le_sup] using isLeast_sdiff
```
I think these were better explicit.

What's your argument for this? Mine for them being implicit is that they likely will never be used in a proof term that doesn't have enough context to prevent unification, and if ever that happens it would be better to add a type ascription rather than adding explicit arguments to some lemma in the middle of the proof term

I can see this being the type of thing where I'd want to write `have := isGreatest_himp (foo x) (bar x)`, and then think a little using the goal state before proceeding. I don't think that `_`s within a proof term are likely to matter, especially since probably nothing much is going to use these lemmas.

Here is a golf
```suggestion
theorem isGreatest_compl [HeytingAlgebra α] {a : α} : IsGreatest {w | Disjoint w a} aᶜ := by
  simp [IsGreatest, mem_upperBounds, le_compl_iff_disjoint_right, disjoint_compl_left]

theorem isLeast_hnot [CoheytingAlgebra α] {a : α} : IsLeast {w | Codisjoint a w} (￢a) := by
  simp [IsLeast, mem_lowerBounds, hnot_le_iff_codisjoint_right, codisjoint_hnot_right]
```
I think my [golf above](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20328#discussion_r1902034081) is better?
I didn't see it before writing mine. My proof has the advantage of being independent of the `sdiff`/`himp` results
I think that's only an advantage if there is a scenario in which they hold more generally.

pullRequest.title: feat(Order/CompleteBooleanAlgebra): Himp in terms of sSup
